intro: [WRONG START] Gunnyopsis septifraga, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gunniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, linear leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color, arranged in spikes. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Gunniopsis septifraga is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is considered a hardy species in its native habitat.
